segments.text: Can ’ t you come in and have tea now , Peter ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not yet , I must water the garden first .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you have to water it now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m afraid I must . Look at it ! It ’ s terribly dry .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Last summer it was very dry , too . Don ’ t you remember ? I had to water it every day .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I ’ ll have tea by myself . That was quick ! Have you finished already ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , Look out of the window .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s raining . That means you needn ’ t water the garden .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That was a pleasant surprise . It means I can have tea , instead .
segments.speaker: S2
